ygData.subject: Re: Guide to Wizardry
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Well, for player made stuff the IT items are ring,necklace,necklace,ring(silver, electrum, gold, plat) and the plat is really expensive...if it s any good
ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, 27 Sep 1999, PHAEDRA WHITLOCK wrote:
> An Enchanter I group with often is up to 11th now, and Im hoping he'll
> be able to turn out some things. All he can do is +2 rings currently,
> and Im not sure if its worth the money, or if I should wait, hoarde,
> and buy something REALLY good, rather than babystep upgrade. Theres a
> 57plat ring at the mages building in Freeport that Id like, and Im
> only 5 gold away from buying it, buuut I have to keep in mind buying
> my level 16 spells too.

Well, for player made stuff the IT items are
ring,necklace,necklace,ring(silver, electrum, gold, plat) and the plat is
really expensive...if it's any good to you i'm lvl 21 and i'm going to be
getting a set of silver +2 int rings to replace my silver mana rings (at
~20 the extra mana from the added int is greater than what the mana rings
give you)

If i were you i'd see about getting a pair of silver INT rings and a
electrum INT necklace...

oh, and check out www.graffe.com for a good listing of helpful wizard
items..(it's also probibly the best wizard site out there...thoguh
eq.castersrealm.com is also good)

> Normally I dont merchant, I scrounge beetle eyes noone wants and I do
> things the Do-Unto-Others system, so I do favors and hope others are
> nice in return. Ive gotten a nearly complete suit of silk, the rings I
> mentioned, the amulet, and a blackened wand (15 magic resistance)
> and given out gifts of pelts and various items I came across. But you
> dont get a lot of cash this way.

Yeah, i do that too...though it does come back to you eventually...i just
recently benafitted from the same thing on a higher level...got a shear
bone mask (+3 int and a decent ac) from a really nice really high level
enchanter...

> Wavering on if I should turn into a miser or deal with breaking even.
> :D Some people charge for Binds, some dont, and I can bind now. :z

persionally i just tell them to pay me what they think it's worth if they
ask..true you dont' make much from it, but sometimes you get lucky...and
sometimes you make a friend..believe it or not a lot of folks will rember
little things like binding them for free...reputation does mean something,
especially when you get to higher levels..

> At what level do you tend to start going to pick up nice magic user
> items? Most quests that grant such things seem geared for lvl 30 and
> up.

not counting the player made jewlery i'd say in your 20' up...
at least that's the point where you start to really be able to kill stuff
that drops decent magical items...you'll probibly start making enough coin
to buy magical stuff from the mid teens on..oh, and a suggestion, get a
dragoon dir instead of a runed totem staff...while you don't melee much
at higher levels, your better off having your decent melee skill being
somthing one handed(piercing would be my choice if i had it to do
again...)

Stannis Starslyder
Wizard of the Moon
Innoruuk
